stories.title: The Ship That Defined Celebrity
stories.intended_reader: Cruise enthusiasts interested in fleet history
stories.markdown:
**Before Millennium, before Solstice, before Edge—there was Century.**

[Celebrity Century](/ships/celebrity-cruises/celebrity-century.html) launched in 1995 and defined what Celebrity would become. The Michel Roux restaurant. The focus on culinary excellence. The design sensibility that prioritized elegance over excess.

She was the first of the Century Class—followed by Galaxy and Mercury. Together, they established Celebrity as the premium alternative to mass-market cruising. Before these ships, the line was still finding its identity.

Century introduced the modern dining concepts that Millennium Class would expand and Edge Class would perfect. The innovation started here. The excellence originated aboard this ship.

**The truth:** Century represents Celebrity's foundation. Understanding this ship explains everything that followed. Her departure from the fleet marked an era's end.

Those who sailed Century remember what she pioneered. The ship that defined the line has left, but her legacy sails on every Celebrity vessel.

stories.title: Memories of Century's Grand Restaurant
stories.core_insight: Century's Grand Restaurant set Celebrity's dining standards
stories.markdown:
**The Grand Restaurant on Century was where Celebrity's culinary reputation was born.**

[Celebrity Century](/ships/celebrity-cruises/celebrity-century.html) featured Michel Roux-designed cuisine that shocked the cruise industry. Actual fine dining at sea. Techniques that belonged in Michelin-starred restaurants. Standards that seemed impossible aboard ships.

The two-deck Grand Restaurant created atmosphere that Millennium's Metropolitan would echo. The presentation. The service. The understanding that dining was experience, not just fuel.

'This isn't cruise ship food,' passengers would observe, surprised.

'This is Celebrity food,' servers would reply. 'Century is where it started.'

The menu rotations. The wine service. The pastry that showed actual training. Everything that makes Celebrity dining exceptional today traces back to Century's Grand Restaurant.

**The truth:** Century's dining innovations became Celebrity's identity. The ship has left the fleet, but her culinary legacy remains the foundation.

Those who dined aboard Century remember the revelation. The first taste of what Celebrity could be.

stories.title: When Century Class Was New
stories.core_insight: Century represented revolutionary design in her era
stories.markdown:
**I sailed Century in 1996. She was the future of cruising.**

[Celebrity Century](/ships/celebrity-cruises/celebrity-century.html) arrived in an industry that hadn't seen her like. The design. The proportions. The sense that ships could be elegant rather than merely large.

At 1,870 passengers, Century felt intimate compared to today's mega-ships. But in 1996, she was modern. Sophisticated. The ship that proved cruising could attract travelers who'd never considered it.

'This is different from other cruise ships,' I told friends afterward.

'This is what cruise ships should become,' I believed.

I was right. Century's innovations—the Murano glass, the culinary program, the design philosophy—became the industry standard. She shaped what we expect from premium cruising.

**The truth:** Century proved what cruising could be. The ship has left the fleet, but her influence shaped everything that followed.

Those who sailed Century early remember the amazement. The ship that showed what was possible.

**The lesson:** Experience teaches discernment.

stories.title: Farewell to a Pioneer
stories.core_insight: Century's departure marked the end of an era
stories.markdown:
**When Century left Celebrity in 2014, an era ended.**

[Celebrity Century](/ships/celebrity-cruises/celebrity-century.html) sailed her final Celebrity voyage after nearly two decades of defining premium cruising. The ship that started it all moved on to new owners, new waters, new passengers.

Those final voyages drew passengers who'd sailed her for years. Returning to say goodbye. Photographing spaces they'd come to love. Grieving a ship as one grieves a friend.

'Ships shouldn't feel like home,' someone said at the farewell dinner.

'Century did,' another replied. 'That was her gift.'

She became SkySea Golden Era for Chinese waters. A different life. A different name. But the bones remain—the ship that taught Celebrity what excellence meant.

**The truth:** Century's departure hurt because she'd meant so much. The foundation ship leaving left empty space the fleet still honors.

Those who loved Century remember her departure. The goodbye to the pioneer.

stories.title: Century Class: The Foundation Ships
stories.core_insight: Century Class established Celebrity's design language
stories.markdown:
**Three ships launched the modern Celebrity era: Century, Galaxy, and Mercury.**

[Celebrity Century](/ships/celebrity-cruises/celebrity-century.html) was first (1995), followed by Galaxy (1996) and Mercury (1997). Together, they created the Century Class—the foundation that Millennium, Solstice, and Edge would build upon.

The ships shared size, design philosophy, and commitment to excellence. Each was slightly refined from the previous. All three established what Celebrity meant: elegant cruising with culinary excellence.

All three have left Celebrity now. Century became SkySea Golden Era. Galaxy became Mein Schiff 3. Mercury became Mein Schiff 2. The physical ships sail on; their Celebrity identity has passed.

**The lesson:** Century Class proved Celebrity's concept.
